channel.title: what I do on Mathematical Michael
channel.description: Recent content in what I do on Mathematical Michael

item.title: art
item.description: Probably Art I combine art, math, and machines to build wonderful things. Start with today. Show biggest achievement. How did we get here? Probability-Dependent Generative Artwork. It was the first experience I had with GUIs, and then the same theme tied together this project. Real-time visualization of randomness, now used to aid in design. I want to find more projects like this. Description Describe your relationship to art. History Moving Pictures summer 2013 History… early Gallery Project Probably Art context Project Present code exists here and needs major reorganization.

item.title: estimation
item.description: Research MUD The Oracle (AKA the Monte-Carlo Calculator) talk about research, wanting to make something useful, something to share. The Oracle is a web app I built to help me make quick estimates without keeping them in my head (and then share them!). Often we find “back-of-the-napkin” calculations to be useful… randall munroe what if … fermi problems wiki … TK TK TK It is deployed with #kubernetes on #google-cloud-platform and is built with #python using #flask.

item.title: architect & engineer
item.description: Software Contributions I’ve learned so much from free software, and want to give back by making the things I build available to others. I believe in making complicated things easier for people to digest, and software contributions is one way to do that. ML Starter-Packs ml-starter-packs is a Github organization I created to house relatively polished projects for public consumption. These are the tools I find myself coming back to over and over, whether for educational or development purposes.

item.title: run events
item.description: Stochastic Poker current min max action Start New Game What's Going on? A coin is being flipped automatically. Heads +1, Tails -1. Keep a running sum. This webpage is your "hand". Find some friends and show them how to get a hand of their own. Choose a unit of value with which to gamble (candy, dimes, chips, etc.). There are six rounds of betting, corresponding to each tick mark in the chart.

item.title: etc
item.description: More Projects Consider this a dumping ground for links to things I want to show people I’ve done.
